text:
- So at Panasonic Energy North
America or PENA for short,
we produce the world's safest,
highest quality lithium-ion batteries.
So in the battery manufacturing industry,
the more we can produce,
the more EVs we can put on the road,

thereby creating a sustainable
future for not only us,
but our kids as well.
Roughly two years ago,
we started a smart factory initiative
and it was very clear to us

that we had multiple
disparate data sources
and we had to really set that foundation
and we didn't quite know where to start.
We engaged AWS, and AWS came in,
helped us coalesce that data,

and then set the stage
for what we now have
as a generative AI platform.

During the process, we
had two key use cases
that we built, leveraging AWS.
One was on a predictive maintenance side

where we were able to
leverage some machine learning
and AI capabilities to reduce our no good
or waste coming from our inline processes.

The other use case was also
a predictive maintenance

use case where we were able
to leverage AWS's technology

to bring in our data and
predict maintenance failures
four to six hours ahead of time,

which significantly helped
the bottom line as well.

In our case, it really
is putting the power
at the fingertips of our employees,
so it's very, very exciting times
where their technology is going.

We can only guesstimate
what that's gonna be

in not just six months,
but a month's time.
(upbeat music)
